channel.title: COMPILER ISSUE!: javac not found and i have it in folder and maybe right options
channel.description:
i keep getting this no matter what i do:
[code]javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac (options) (source files) use -help for a list of possible options Finished! Press any key to continue...[/code]
and here is what the compiler says in notepad:
[code]@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/... :end echo Finished! pause exit [/code]
And i have all the jdk programs and ddl's in the bin folder. But still it says i dont have javac, even though i do. Also I'm using DavidScape 7.0 so anyone who has that should know the answer maybe.
Thanks :-) Appriciate the help.

item.title: COMPILER ISSUE!: javac not found and i have it in folder and maybe right options
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Wrong section.

Also, you need to put the compiler with the Java files, It needs to compile them into class files.

Read full topic
